STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 4, 2024
Tracey Ventola
Catholic Charities of Jackson, Lenawee & Hillsdale
425 Ormsby St,
Adrian, MI, 49221-2341
RE: License#: CB460308844
Dear Ms. Ventola:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 11/18/2024 . An exit cnference was held with your agency on 11/21/2024. Due to the
violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at 517-899-6024.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Lonia Perry Calloway, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT

Adrian, MI 49221-2341

Applicants for adoption, Place children for
adoption, Place children in foster home

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12202 Policy and procedures.
(1) An agency shall have and follow written policies and
procedures for all the areas of foster care services as
provided in R400.12203 to R 400.12214.
The agency requires annual ICHAT and central registry clearances for its staff.
One of six employee records reviewed showed the employee's annual 2024
ICHAT and completed central registry clearance were completed 11 and 17 days
late respectively.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records.
(3) The personnel record must contain both of the
following:
(a) A written evaluation of a staff member's
performance within a probationary period or not later
than 6 months after the staff member assumes his or
her current responsibilities. After the initial evaluation, a
written evaluation must be conducted every 12 months.
One of six employee records reviewed showed the employee’s annual evaluation
was due by 10/10/2024 and completed 13 days late on 10/23/2024.

CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by
another agency the borrowing agency shall have a
record containing all the following:
(b) Verification that the foster parent is willing to accept
the foster child.
One of three borrowed home records reviewed did not show verification that both
foster parents were willing to accept the child, related to a 7/1/2024 placement.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by
another agency the borrowing agency shall have a
record containing all the following:
(f) Documentation that the foster parent has received
orientation to the policies of the borrowing agency.
One of three borrowed home records reviewed did not show documentation of the
foster parents’ orientation to the agency's policies and procedures, for a child's
7/1/2024 placement.
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by
another agency the borrowing agency shall have a
record containing all the following:
(g) A copy of the foster parent /agency agreement
signed by the foster parent and the borrowing agency.
One of three borrowed home records reviewed did not show documentation of a
foster parent/agency agreement signed by both foster parents, for a child's
7/1/2024 placement.
CPA Rule 400.12420 Updated service plans.
(1) An updated service plan, as required in R
400.12418(2)(b), must include all the following
information:
(g) A child behavior support plan that includes any
changes made since the previous plan and is to be
used by the foster parents.

One of six open foster child records reviewed did not show documentation of a
behavior support plan to be used for the child, as required by the rule.
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation.
(1) An agency social service worker shall complete a
written adoptive evaluation within 90 days of the family
signing an adoption application and prior to approving a
family for adoption.
Two of four approved adoptive family records reviewed did not include
documentation that the family's adoption evaluation was completed within 90
days of the family's 8/22/2023 and 6/1/2024 respective application dates.
Repeat Violation Established
Interim January 2024, CAP approved 2/2/2024
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
R324(2)(b) Reevaluation:
• The agency was apprised it shall consistently document both the foster
parent’s strengths and weaknesses as assessed by the worker, as well as
what the foster parent reports as their own strengths and weaknesses.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
R400.12308-Application submission:
• The agency was advised ensuring that its social contacts are consistently
entered in CWLM might aid it in showing its progress on an applicant's
licensure, therein its actions on the signed application.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted one corrective action plan(CAP) during this licensing
period. This corrective action plan related to the agency’s Interim inspection
completed 1/16/2024 where it received five rule violations. For this Renewal
inspection, the agency received seven rule violations, one of which is a repeat
violation from the interim inspection. Nothwithstanding the slight increase in the
number of citations listed this inspection, which was due in part, how subrules are
not listed/counted, as three are in this category, the agency has made progress on
its corrective action plan. The agency continues to demonstrate many areas of
compliance.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The agency submitted a chief administrator’s (CA) report dated 9/30/2024. The
CA assessment indicated that overall, the agency had done a good job with its
CAP and have been able to resolve some non-compliance from the prior year.
The CA assessment indicated the agency assessed its personnel and adoption
records to be the agency’s strongest areas and that the noncompliance cited prior
related more about timeliness of paperwork as opposed to child safety.
The agency further indicated that although they have been able to maintain staff,
hiring of additional staff to ensure for ongoing caseload compliance has been
difficult. As had FTM timeframes. The agency reported it is continuing its efforts in
these areas. They hired two new staff since the last inspection, and they
implemented new form tracking related to FTMs. The agency indicates they will
continue their efforts towards ongoing compliance.
Financial Overview
The agency submitted a 2024 annual budget and independent financial audit for
the year that ended 12/31/2023. A review of these documents did not show areas
of concern.
Staff and Youth Interviews
In addition to a discussion with the chief administrator, Foster Care/Licensing
supervisor and a foster supervisor during the entrance conference, I interviewed
one foster care worker, and two licensing/adoption workers. The agency staff are
crossed trained. The staff interviewed reported the agency advocates for the
children’s best interest; encourages, supports, and advocates for its foster
parents. Additionally, they have support from their coworkers, supervisor, and
director who was described as amazing and one who aids all in seeing all sides of
a situation. Areas reported as needing work or improvement was for more training
for staff in various areas, salary increases, more work with caseload issues, and a
decrease in negativity and unrealistic expectations from some staff members.
Description of Agency Walk Through

A walk through of the facility did not indicate any concerns or safety issues. The
agency has sufficient space and equipment for its staff; and files are securely
stored.
VII. DCWL ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety alerts.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
November 25, 2024
_____________________________________
Lonia Perry Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
December 4, 2024

Rorie Dodge-Pifer Date
Area Manager
